subject: Investing
title: System 1 vs. System 2 Thinking
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: System 1 vs. System 2 Thinking.

hook.text: You see a stock down 40% and feel 'it's cheap!' before checking a single financial statement.

buildup.text: System 1 is fast, instinctive, emotional. System 2 is slow, analytical, deliberate.

discovery.text: Most investment mistakes happen when System 1 hijacks the decision before System 2 can engage.

twist.text: System 1 evolved for quick survival decisions, not for evaluating P/E ratios or bond durations.

climax.text: Introducing a 24-hour rule before any trade forces System 2 to catch up with System 1.

punchline.text: Fast thinking buys stocks. Slow thinking builds portfolios.
